Definition at line 14 of file camera.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Camera::Camera (  ) 

The default constructor for the camera class. By default the following are set:

eyePosition: 0, 0, 1 lookAtPosition: 0, 0, 0 upDirection: 1, 0, 0 frustum[]: {-1, 1, -1, 1, 2, 100} angleLeftFunct: NULL angleUpFunct: NULL

Definition at line 23 of file camera.cpp.

00024 {
00025     //Set up defaults
00026     eyePosition = Point3(0,0,1);
00027     lookAtPosition = Point3(0,0,0);
00028     upDirection = Point3(1,0,0);
00029 
00030     frustum[0] = -1;
00031     frustum[1] = 1;
00032     frustum[2] = -1;
00033     frustum[3] = 1;
00034     frustum[4] = 2;
00035     frustum[5] = 100;
00036 
00037     angleLeftFunct = angleUpFunct = NULL;
00038 }

Camera::Camera ( Point3  pos,
Point3  lookAt,
Point3  up 
)

The constructor for the camera class. Sets up frustum as the default:

frustum[] = {-1, 1, -1, 1, 2, 100}

To change it, use setFrustum()

Parameters:
pos is the position of the camera
lookAt is the location that the camera is looking at
up is the direction that is 'up', with reference to the camera
See also:

void Camera::setFrustum ( GLdouble  left,
GLdouble  right,
GLdouble  bottom,
GLdouble  top,
GLdouble  zNear,
GLdouble  zFar 
)

Set the viewing frustum. A recommended call would be as follows (width/height are the width and height of the window):

left: -width/height right: width/height bottom: -1 top: 1 zNear: 2 zFar: 100

Parameters:
left is the left edge of the viewing frustum
right is the right edge of the viewing frustum
bottom is the bottom edge of the viewing frustum
top is the top edge of the viewing frustum
zNear is the distance to the nearest clipping plane, must be greater than 0
zFar is the distance to the farthest clipping plane, must be greater than zNear

Definition at line 123 of file camera.cpp.

00124 {
00125     frustum[0] = left;
00126     frustum[1] = right;
00127     frustum[2] = bottom;
00128     frustum[3] = top;
00129     frustum[4] = zNear;
00130     frustum[5] = zFar;
00131 }

void Camera::update (  ) 

This function updates the projection matrix so that it includes the camera at its current position, direction, etc. Should be called before each frame is rendered.

Definition at line 137 of file camera.cpp.

00138 {
00139     glMatrixMode(GL_PROJECTION);
00140     glLoadIdentity();
00141     glFrustum(frustum[0], frustum[1], frustum[2], frustum[3], frustum[4], frustum[5]);
00142     gluLookAt(eyePosition.x, eyePosition.y, eyePosition.z, lookAtPosition.x, lookAtPosition.y, lookAtPosition.z, upDirection.x, upDirection.y, upDirection.z);
00143 
00144     glMatrixMode(GL_MODELVIEW);
00145     glLoadIdentity();
00146 }

void Camera::spinRightAroundCenter ( GLdouble  angle  ) 

SpinRightAroundCenter moves (as you would expect) to the right, from the perspective of the viewer, a though the camera were on the surface of a sphere centered at lookAtPosition

Parameters:
angle is the angle in degrees that you wish to rotate by
See also:
lookAtPosition

eyePosition

setLookAtPosition()

Definition at line 165 of file camera.cpp.

00165                                                  {
00166     double radius = (eyePosition - lookAtPosition).getMag();
00167 
00168     //Set up some basis vectors for the plane in which you want to move
00169     Point3 basisY = (eyePosition - lookAtPosition).getUnit();
00170     Point3 basisX = Point3::cross(basisY, upDirection).getUnit();
00171 
00172     //Rotate the basis vectors by angle, this is the vector to translate
00173     //to our final destination
00174     Point3 returnVector = basisX*cos((angle+90)*(PI/180.0)) + basisY*sin((angle+90)*(PI/180.0));
00175 
00176     //Translate to the final position
00177     eyePosition = lookAtPosition + returnVector.getUnit()*radius;
00178 }

void Camera::spinUpAroundCenter ( GLdouble  angle  ) 

This spins you in the up direction, from the perspective of the viewer, as though on the surface of a sphere centered at lookAtPosition

Parameters:
angle is the angle in degrees that you wish to spin.
See also:
lookAtPosition

setLookAtPosition()

Definition at line 188 of file camera.cpp.

00188                                               {
00189     double radius = (eyePosition - lookAtPosition).getMag();
00190 
00191     //Set up some basis vectors for the plane in which you want to move
00192     Point3 basisY = (eyePosition - lookAtPosition).getUnit();
00193     Point3 basisX = Point3::cross(basisY, upDirection).getUnit();
00194     Point3 basisZ = Point3::cross(basisX, basisY).getUnit();
00195 
00196     //Rotate the basis vectors by angle, this is the vector to translate
00197     //to our final destination
00198     Point3 returnVector = basisY*cos((angle)*(PI/180.0)) + basisZ*sin((angle)*(PI/180.0));
00199 
00200     //Adjust the upDirection
00201     upDirection = basisZ;
00202 
00203     //Translate to the final position
00204     eyePosition = lookAtPosition + returnVector.getUnit()*radius;
00205 }

void Camera::spinViewAroundCenter ( GLdouble  angle  ) 

This rotates the apparent view of the camera in the counter- clockwise direction. Really just changing the upDirection vector

Parameters:
angle is The angle in degrees you wish to spin
See also:
upDirection

setUpDirection()

00219     Point3 basisX = Point3::cross(basisY, upDirection).getUnit();
00220     Point3 basisZ = Point3::cross(basisX, basisY).getUnit();
00221 
00222     //Adjust the upDirection
00223     upDirection = basisX*cos((90+angle)*(PI/180.0)) + basisZ*sin((90+angle)*(PI/180.0));
00224 }

void Camera::zoomIn ( GLdouble  amount  ) 

Zoom the camera in or out, depending on value of amount

Parameters:
amount is a number between 0 and infinity. Numbers less than one zoom in, numbers greater than one zoom out

Definition at line 231 of file camera.cpp.

00232 {
00233     eyePosition = eyePosition * amount;

GLdouble  amount 
)

Shift the camera in some direction by some amount

Parameters:
direction is a vector pointing in the direction of the shift
amount is the distance of the shift
